page.title: 08KIRKNEWTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The parish church of St Gregory the Great,built 11th C,serves one of the largest parishes in England.Oldest part still standing is the low,thick_ walled chancel.The rest of the church has been knocked down and rebuilt since.The grave of Josephine Butler (1828_1906),Victorian social reformer, is in the church yard,which also contains a war cemetery of several commonwealth airmen. The vicar,who is part of the Glendale Team of ministers(which serves eleven parishes),no longer lives in Kirknewton.The Vicarage is now in Wooler;the former Vicarage now being a private house. Holy Communion_1st,3rd & 5th Sundays Matins _2nd & 4th Sundays The ASB is used for communion,the Book of Common Prayer for Matins and occasional services.
